constraints_details.constraints_layer_description: A4D Storage and distribution to residential

description: Variation of condition 2 (Approved plans) attached to planning permission ref 2019/4193 dated 17/07/2020 for the Variation of condition 2 (plans) attached to planning permission ref: 2017/4332 dated 30/05/2018. The variation seeks to make changes to the roof (extension and layout) on level 5, changes to the design of the windows, and the front entrance, and add drainpipes.
decision_conditions: <p>3. Notwithstanding the details shown on the plans and documents hereby approved (including 1:10 drawings already supplied no. 1130.74c and 113.75d), the following details to consist of drawings scaled 1:10/1:20 (including pictures of precedents) and material samples for all the visible parts of the scheme, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the relevant works. This should include but not be limited to:</p><p>- Two options of metal roof cladding</p><p>- Rear stairs</p><p>- Balconies/balustrades</p><p>- Coping</p><p>- Swift boxes at roof level</p><p>The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved.</p><p>REASON: To ensure that the external appearance of the building is satisfactory and does not detract from the character and visual amenity of the area.</p>

<p>The proposed roof area of the fifth floor extension hereby approved shall be used for maintenance purposes only and not used as terrace area.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To safeguard against overlooking and noise impacts to adjoining properties.</p>
<p>12. The use of the proposed external terrace, shall be limited to the hours between 09:00 and 21:00 Mon-Sun and Bank Holidays.</p><p>REASON: In order to safeguard residential amenity.</p>

<p>4. Prior to the commencement of the relevant works detailed section drawings, scaled 1:5 and 1:10, across all parts of the building, showing clearly the interface between all new materials and features, including sills and the interface with brickwork; coping; zinc cladding and glass curtain walling, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.</p><p>REASON: To ensure a high design standard</p>

<p>15. The development shall only be implemented in accordance with the details and measures approved as part of the demolition and construction management plan (dated 09/03/2020), which shall be maintained throughout the entire construction period.</p><p>REASON: To avoid hazard and obstruction being caused to users of the public highway and in the interest of public safety and amenity.</p>

<p>14. The extended elements of the development shall not be occupied until a Scheme of Highway Improvement Works necessary to serve this development, including the removal of the existing vehicle crossover at the western end of the site has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and completed in full in accordance with the approved details.</p><p>REASON: In the interests of highway and pedestrian safety and to ensure the development is well integrated with its surroundings.</p>

<p>13. Prior to the occupation of the extended elements of the development, the following shall be submitted to the local planning authority for consideration by, and approval in writing by, the planning sub-committee of the local planning authority:</p><p>- A Travel Plan indicating what measures will be implemented to minimise the impact of the increased employee numbers on road traffic, parking and highway safety.</p><p>The approved details shall be implemented within one month of their approval.</p><p>REASON: To protect the general amenity of the area and that of surrounding occupiers.</p>

<p>11. The development shall only be implemented in accordance with the details and measures approved as part of the letter from HOP consulting (JWO/LB/14976-2), which shall be maintained throughout the entire construction period.</p><p>REASON: To protect the Crossrail 2 safeguarding area.</p>

<p>10. No soil stacks, soil vent pipes, flues, ductwork or any other pipework shall be fixed to the elevations of the building other than as shown on the drawings hereby approved, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.</p><p>REASON: To ensure that the external appearance of the building is satisfactory and does not detract from the character and visual amenity of the area.</p>

<p>9. The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved, including document nos. 1130.52c and 205 8504 25 and shall be fully implemented before the premises are first occupied.&nbsp;</p><p>REASON: To enhance the character and ecology of the development, to provide undisturbed refuges for wildlife, to promote sustainable urban drainage, and to enhance the performance and efficiency of the proposed building.</p>

<p>8. Prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved a minimum of two Swift nesting bricks and/or boxes shall be provided at or close to eaves level of the development hereby approved. The bricks/boxes shall be retained thereafter in perpetuity.</p><p>REASON: In the interests of biodiversity.</p>

<p>7. Any new non-CHP space and hot water fossil fuel (or equivalent hydrocarbon based fuel) boilers installed within the development must achieve dry NOx emission levels equivalent to or less than 40 mg/kWh, prior to first occupation of the development.</p><p>REASON: To protect air quality, human health and to contribute towards National Air Quality Objectives.</p>

<p>6. The fixed plant and equipment shown on the roof plan hereby approved shall be located and installed so as not to be visible above the parapet of the building when viewed from street level.</p><p>REASON: To ensure that the external appearance of the building is satisfactory and does not detract from the character and visual amenity of the area</p>

<p>5. Notwithstanding the details shown on the plans and documents hereby approved, the following details to consist of drawings indicating all materials, biodiverse planting and animal friendly fencing shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the relevant works. The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved.</p><p>REASON: To ensure that the external appearance of the building is satisfactory and does not detract from the character and visual amenity of the emerging conservation area.</p>

The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this permission.


REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

The Development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any subsequent approval of details.


REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.
